Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory45.jpg'}
{1: 'Babylonia', 2: 'Third Central Bridge'}
{1: '1', 3: "Before a giant window wall of the bridge, a few operators from CC gather around a Construct that's busy working away on the virtual panel."}
{3: 'Dozens of variables for coordinates flash under the pair of amber eyes. After carefully verifying the data, the Construct lets out a sigh, and the Inver-Device on her head sags down.'}
{3: 'She does a quick wave to close the virtual panel and turns to face the anxious operators.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Um... The coordinate data calculation is bugged, which means that every observation results in a thousand-kilometer error in distance.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'So it is a fact that our Interstellar Observer is malfunctioning and can no longer be used for military strategy and real-time ground surveillance.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Command Center Operator', 3: "That... that won't do.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Cold sweat gathers on his forehead as he looks at the ceiling.'}
{3: 'With a holographic image projected onto the center of the bridge, the giant dome is speckled with countless dots of light.'}
{3: 'It is a military map based on Earth used by CC to issue missions to the Task Force on the ground.'}

{3: 'Operators are tasked with recording real-time data received from the map and use this data to make decisions for battle strategies. Any error will have disastrous results if they give the Task Force misdirected instructions.'}
{3: 'All of this relies on the accurate coordinate calculation system, which is supplied by the Babylonia Interstellar Observer.'}
{3: 'Any error in this device will cause a complete breakdown of operations in CC and the Task Force.'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Command Center Operator', 3: "How long would it take the Engineering Force to fix the Observer? City 043 is in a critical stage in its battle. We've sent in five elite squads, and every order given is of monumental importance.", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'The system is very complicated. I need to first figure out the cause of the issue. The Optical Atomic Clocks inside the Observer is a highly delicate device and will take some work to repair.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Command Center Operator', 3: 'Then...', 4: '2'}
{3: "Sensing the despair in the operator's voice, Karenina clenches her fists and changes her attitude."}
{3: 'She clenches her teeth and thumps her chest with a little pride.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Well, who do you think I am? It's nothing more than a mega GPS. Any intern from the Engineering Force can fix it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'How much time do I have?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Command Center Operator', 3: 'With the battle going on on the surface, at most 48 hours...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Twenty hours. That's all I need.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Command Center Operator', 3: "Really? Holy, you're a godsend, Karenina! If we can't get it back to normal, we might have to give up on everything we have at City 043—", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Alright, alright, totally caught your drift there. I gotta head back to the Engineering Force to fetch some equipment now.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'RImgBg1DisableSlow'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory284.jpg'}
{3: "Karenina's had enough of this emotional operator and quickly exits the bridge onto the hallway."}
{1: '1', 3: 'She scans her surroundings to check that she is alone and turns on her communication device.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory175.png', 2: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Hey, hey! Teddy! Are you there? How many guys do we have stationed at Babylonia right now?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "That totally came out of nowhere, but let's see... 24 here on their shift. We're all in the workshop at the factory, testing out uh... something interesting.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Hey, intern, too much fuel. Are you trying to blow us up?!', 4: '2'}
{3: 'On the other side of the line, Teddy is with members of the Engineering Force. She seems to be supervising their work.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Count everyone that's on vacay, too. Oh, and you. Get over here immediately.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'This sounds urgent. What happened?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Duh! You think I'm just fooling around?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Babylonia's Interstellar Observer is malfunctioning and needs fixing immediately. It affects the deployment of ground forces, so I want the entire team on it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "The entire team? That sounds super serious. Oh, I see what's going on now... You can't get it done by yourself, right?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Uh... Well, be that as it may, how does that help with the situation in any meaningful way?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'I\'m just making a wild guess, but did you happen to tell people there five minutes ago that you can "fix this in my sleep"?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "Okay, I'm done. I'll get everyone to head over right now.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Listen up! Captain wants all of us to head down to her designated location at once.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Teddy gathers all the members with a clap of her hands.'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "We'll be there in five minutes. Use that time to come up with a plan, Captain.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: '...Thank you guys.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Realizing that it's not a fair order to some of the members, Karenina nods to Teddy to express her gratitude."}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Well, not the first time. Just remember to keep your promise.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Teddy gives Karenina a smile and hangs up.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory529.jpg'}
{1: 'Babylonia', 2: 'World Government Association of Art'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ayla', 3: "Ah... here it is. Here's your last copy as usual with the signatures from the main production team.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Bianca nods in thanks as she takes the collectible movie disc set box from Ayla.'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Thanks a lot, Ayla. It must have been a lot of trouble to get this for me. This movie seems quite popular in Babylonia.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Don't worry about it. An old fan like you deserves some special treatment, and you're always too busy to make it to the releases.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'I watched this when it came out, and I liked it so much that I really wanted to keep a copy in my collection.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "I'll let the crew know. I'm sure they'll be delighted to hear that.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'But I do feel bad for asking you to do this for me every time...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Don't worry about it. I know you'd do the same for me if I were the one asking for help, Bianca.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Of course, if it's something I can do.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Oh, and that reminds me...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Says Ayla with a suspicious smile.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'That I do have a favor to ask of you.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Ayla digs out a package from under the counter. It is an item sealed in a WGAA box that looks old and dusty.'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "What's that?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "I heard someone asked WGAA to keep it a long, long time ago. It's long past its storage period, but nobody came to claim it, so we don't know what to do with it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'They went through the usual process of searching for the owner of the package, but he left Babylonia long ago.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'So you want me to find the owner?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "...I don't think you'll need to look for him. You probably know who he is.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "I was a little curious, so I asked Sica to look into Babylonia's database for me, and...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Wait, I know this person? But if it's been so long...", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Bianca takes the package and studies the faded letters on the seal.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Ring any bell?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Bianca silently reads the long-forgotten name that brings to mind a series of memories.'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Yes, I've heard the name... and I sort of know him, too.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Light flickers in her eyes as past memories stir up a wealth of emotions.'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'He was part of the Cosmos Technicians Union, a renowned physicist and engineer.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "And he was also Karenina's mentor... in the past.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory648.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryZhengyanNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryMovieFilm.prefab', 2: '3'}
{3: 'When she opened her eyes, she was in another world.'}
{3: "One that's unfamiliar and cold."}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'What... in the world is...'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Surgical Assistant', 3: 'Vital signs stable. Inver-Device successfully implanted. Infection rate within a safe range.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Surgical Manager', 3: 'The operation is over. Well done, everyone.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Surgical Manager', 3: "Construct surgery operation success rate has increased by 80% thanks to Professor Kalon's technology, should the host demonstrate adaptability to Tantalum-193.", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Surgical Manager', 3: "Constructs are our best countermeasure against the Punishing. This is a significant breakthrough. We'll be able to manufacture Constructs more efficiently and use them to battle the virus.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Surgical Assistant', 3: "Well... what's going to happen to this kid, then?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Surgical Assistant', 3: "Should we let her join the Construct defense team? The success rate looks good now, but we've still got to have the adaptability issue figured out.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Surgical Assistant', 3: 'Only a handful of humans can make it.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Surgical Manager', 3: "...No. We'll respect her will. We've benefitted greatly from Professor Kalon's technology. This will count as a small compensation.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Grandpa... are you in there...?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Grandpa... don't... don't leave me...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her pleas are not answered.'}
{3: 'Darkness devours her eyesight and leaves only unbearable pain in her mind.'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryMovieFilm.prefab'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory315.png'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryZhengyanNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{3: 'She jolts awake from her sleep.'}
{3: 'Karenina looks down at her still unfamiliar "new body" in silence.'}
{3: 'The tiny heart that beat silently in the dead of the night inside her feeble body is gone.'}
{3: 'Her frail physical form and senses are replaced by hard metal.'}
{3: 'The way she sensed the world had changed completely. Like the "Ship of Theseus", she can\'t be sure if she is still the same "Karenina".'}
{3: 'She should have died with Grandpa Kalon the night they were ambushed by the Corrupted.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Construct...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'When she woke up, her surgeon gave her an overview of the process and briefly explained the idea of a "Construct".'}
{3: 'Afterward, she was sent to live in a Ground Defense Force base. The manager told her that she could do as she pleased while getting used to her new identity.'}
{3: 'But that proved to be much harder to do than said. Many days had passed and she still felt lost.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Grandpa...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She thought about sneaking back to the slums where she lived with Grandpa, but as a Construct, her every move was carefully monitored by the army, and they forbade her to visit infected areas.'}
{3: 'She drew open her tent and saw hungry refugees lining up for porridge nearby.'}
{3: 'Karenina found herself drawn toward the line by the aroma.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Male Refugee', 3: "Hey, what are you doing here? Constructs don't need food. You aren't going to fight us for the food here, are you?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Female Refugee', 3: "Yeah... there isn't even enough to begin with...", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Geez, did I even say I came for the food? Cut me some slack already.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She was in no mood to squabble with these people... because she never felt "hungry" anymore.'}

{3: "She didn't need to eat, would never get sick, and had physical capabilities many times those of a human... These were the difference between a Construct and a human as explained to her by a technician."}
{3: "What he didn't tell her, though, was the difference in mentality and identity that she would be experiencing."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cgqz504.jpg'}
{3: 'If having Katie and Tom call her an "outcast" back then hurt, what she was experiencing now was definitely more heart-wrenching.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory315.png'}
{3: 'She wandered around the empty space like a feral cat in an unfamiliar territory, surveying the area with wary eyes.'}
{3: 'In response to her unknown anxiety, heightened senses and increased vigilance were imposed upon her.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Little Girl', 3: 'Mom, do you see that girl over there...?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Young Mother', 3: 'Shh, be quiet. Come here.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'A girl about five or six of age gave Karenina strange looks before her mother quickly shepherded her away.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Yeah? What the heck are you looking at...', 4: '1'}
{3: "The mother couldn't help but stare at Karenina's exposed metal arm and Inver-Device. Noticing the stare, Karenina shoved her arm in annoyance into her deep pockets and turned to leave."}
{3: 'She approached a group of boys playing in a clearing, but they quickly tensed up and backed off when they noticed her.'}
{2: 'Frail Boy', 3: 'Wha—What do you want...?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: '...I have a few questions to ask.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Frail Boy', 3: "I—I don't know anything!", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Older boy', 3: "Hey... let's go somewhere else...", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Older boy', 3: "You-you-you... Don't follow us!", 4: '3'}
{3: 'The boy led the group and ran off in the distance, leaving Karenina all alone by herself.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'I swear to God...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She squinted her eyebrows and pulled down her hat to conceal her conspicuous "Inver-Device".'}
{3: "She shouldn't have minded all the strange looks because this wasn't anything new to her."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cgqz503.jpg'}
{3: 'She was able to completely forget the senseless hostility back then because she knew that someone in the world cared about her.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg2801_07.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '2'}
{3: "She would listen to Grandpa Kalon's wild fairy tales every night and try crazy science experiments together on their days off."}
{3: 'Hurtful words and looks coming from some of the children her age were nothing compared to all the wonderful times she got to spend with Grandpa.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory315.png'}
{1: '1', 3: 'And now, she found herself alone in the world once again.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'And now...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'An unkempt man who looked about 30 came up to Karenina from behind.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'What? Who are you? What do you want?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Karenina turned around to look the man over.'}
{3: "The man's attire reminded her of the surgeons who turned her into a Construct, and she never really liked them."}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'How long have you lived with Professor Kalon? Did he ever tell you anything about himself?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The man spoke with a cold, indifferent, but sharp tone.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'You... Do you know my grandpa? Is he still alive?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'Professor Kalon is gone. He cannot come back from the dead.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: "Looks like you don't know anything. I'm not going to waste my time.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Wait!', 4: '1'}
{3: "Karenina pulled on Wise's hand, gritting her teeth with an aggressive glare, like an injured fierce cat."}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "It's true that I don't know anything! But you do, right?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Tell me about Grandpa Kalon! What did he do? Why do you call him "professor"? And who are you?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: "I'm under no obligation to answer any of that.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'But I have the right to know!', 4: '1'}
{3: "Karenina's yelling rang in his ear and he stayed silent."}
{2: 'Wise', 3: '...And what do I stand to gain from telling you?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: "Nothing, and that's why you have no right whatsoever.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "...Then what should I do?! I didn't ask to become like this!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "I know Grandpa was a great man. He always writes impressive things in his notebook. I didn't understand half of it, but...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "I lived with him for so long, but know close to nothing about him... And I'll never get to talk to him again because he's gone...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'I just want to know a little more about him! Nothing more! Is that too big of a favor to ask?!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: "...You said you didn't under half of what he wrote. Does that mean you understood the other half?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "S-so what if I did? Grandpa taught me things here and there. What's wrong with that?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'Let go, and go get some clean sheets of paper and a pen.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'For what?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'A test to see if you have the potential to access the world Professor Kalon gave his life for.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Wise', 3: "47% correct... As for each topic... A good understanding of Newton's laws and analytical mechanics... A basic grasp of electromagnetism, but almost no knowledge of thermodynamics and statistical mechanics...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'And terrible at all other basic sciences...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'A bare pass.', 4: '2'}
{3: "Wise took one last glance at Karenina's answer sheet, carefully folded it, and put it away."}
{3: 'She never had a proper education and was using many theories and formulas incorrectly. Without rigorous scientific training, her methods of proof were anything but methodical.'}
{3: 'But these skills could be perfected with practice since Karenina already had what it took to become an outstanding researcher.'}
{3: 'Perhaps it was from the influence of Professor Kalon, or perhaps Kalon adopted Karenina because he saw her potential...'}
{3: 'Wise lowered his head and was lost in thought as he reevaluated the girl.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Hey! You said I passed. So you will tell me about Grandpa now?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With Wise keeping his silence, Karenina grew impatient.'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'No, I cannot tell you, and neither will I.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Are you ****ing with me?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'To achieve something, you first have to be able to do it.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'Professor Kalon was a renowned scientist. His world is not comparable to a girl born in the slums.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'If you want to understand who he was and what he has done for the world...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'Then you first have to be part of the world of science.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The grandpa she knew sounds dramatically different from the person Wise is describing.'}
{3: 'He was a normal old man who sometimes seemed a bit crazy when he talked about profound-sounding things that nobody could even begin to understand.'}
{3: "He didn't have a halo above his head, and she never knew he had incredible achievements."}
{3: "In front of her is an unfamiliar path leading her to Kalon's past and her future."}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'What do I need to do?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'I can take you to a place...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Wise', 3: 'Where you can learn everything you need to know.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Wise reaches out to Karenina as an invitation to "the world" that they belong to.'}
{3: 'Karenina did not hesitate. She pulled out the cold, metal arm in her pocket...'}
{3: 'And grabbed the equally cold hand of the man.'}
